sources.title: Forget Audible - ChatGPT can now read documents and even ebooks out loud to you (and it's surprisingly good)
sources.snippet:
The article from Tom‚Äôs Guide highlights a new feature in ChatGPT that allows it to read documents and ebooks aloud, offering a viable alternative to text-to-speech apps like Speechify and audiobook services like Audible. This Read Aloud feature is integrated into the free ChatGPT mobile app for both iPhone and Android users and does not require a ChatGPT Plus subscription. Users can upload a file or paste text into a chat, and ChatGPT reads it back using a natural, human-like voice. 

Compared to paid services, ChatGPT's Read Aloud is praised for being free, seamless, and context-aware, making it especially useful for productivity, writing, and on-the-go listening. Some noted downsides include the manual uploading of documents and occasional interruptions with prompts to continue reading. Regardless, users find it highly effective for most everyday needs and a compelling alternative to pricier or less intuitive solutions.

citation_mappings.claim_text: ChatGPT Read Aloud (ChatGPT mobile) ‚Äì can read pasted documents and uploads with natural voice at no extra cost. Tom's Guide
